Html:
According to the msdn library there should be a Rows property in the Worksheet class.
On my client there MS Office 2007 is installed. So i have looked again in the msdn library

http://msdn.microsoft.com/de-de/library/microsoft.office.interop.excel.worksheetclass_members%28v=office.11%29.aspx

http://msdn.microsoft.com/de-de/library/microsoft.office.interop.excel.worksheetclass_members%28v=office.14%29.aspx

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb215251%28v=office.12%29.aspx

I have found that intellisense was misleading me to another direction :)

If u want to count the rows of yourWorksheet u can use this
yourWorksheet.UsedRange.Rows.Count
